title: Google\Cloud\PubSub\PubSubClient
name: PubSubClient
description:
Google Cloud Pub/Sub allows you to send and receive messages between independent applications. Find more information at the Google Cloud Pub/Sub docs.

To enable the Google Cloud Pub/Sub Emulator, set the PUBSUB_EMULATOR_HOST environment variable.

This client supports transport over REST or gRPC.

In order to enable gRPC support please make sure to install and enable the gRPC extension through PECL:

$ pecl install grpc

NOTE: Support for gRPC is currently at an Alpha quality level, meaning it is still a work in progress and is more likely to get backwards-incompatible updates.

When using gRPC in production environments, it is highly recommended that you make use of the Protobuf PHP extension for improved performance. Protobuf can be installed via PECL.

$ pecl install protobuf

examples.caption: Using the Pub/Sub Emulator

params.name: config
params.description: Configuration Options.

params.name: config.apiEndpoint
params.description: The hostname with optional port to use in place of the default service endpoint. Example: foobar.com or foobar.com:1234.

params.name: config.projectId
params.description: The project ID from the Google Developer's Console.

params.name: config.authCache
params.description: A cache for storing access tokens. Defaults to a simple in memory implementation.

params.name: config.authCacheOptions
params.description: Cache configuration options.

params.name: config.authHttpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests specifically for authentication.

params.name: config.credentialsFetcher
params.description: A credentials fetcher instance.

params.name: config.httpHandler
params.description: A handler used to deliver Psr7 requests. Only valid for requests sent over REST.

params.name: config.keyFile
params.description: The contents of the service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developer's Console. Ex: json_decode(file_get_contents($path), true).

params.name: config.keyFilePath
params.description: The full path to your service account credentials .json file retrieved from the Google Developers Console.

params.name: config.requestTimeout
params.description: Seconds to wait before timing out the request. Defaults to 0 with REST and 60 with gRPC.

params.name: config.retries
params.description: Number of retries for a failed request. Defaults to 3.

params.name: config.scopes
params.description: Scopes to be used for the request.

params.name: config.quotaProject
params.description: Specifies a user project to bill for access charges associated with the request.

params.name: config.transport
params.description: The transport type used for requests. May be either grpc or rest. Defaults to grpc if gRPC support is detected on the system.

methods.name: createTopic
methods.description:
Create a topic.

Unlike Google\Cloud\PubSub\PubSubClient::topic(), this method will send an API call to create the topic. If the topic already exists, an exception will be thrown. When in doubt, use Google\Cloud\PubSub\PubSubClient::topic().

params.name: name
params.description: The topic name

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options. For available configuration options, refer to Google\Cloud\PubSub\Topic::create().

methods.name: topic
methods.description:
Lazily instantiate a topic with a topic name.

No API requests are made by this method. If you want to create a new topic, use Google\Cloud\PubSub\Topic::createTopic().

examples.caption: No API request yet!

params.name: name
params.description: The topic name

methods.name: topics
methods.description: Get a list of the topics registered to your project.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: subscribe
methods.description:
Create a Subscription. If the subscription does not exist, it will be created.

Use Google\Cloud\PubSub\PubSubClient::subscription() to create a subscription object without any API requests. If the topic already exists, an exception will be thrown. When in doubt, use Google\Cloud\PubSub\PubSubClient::subscription().

examples.caption: Create a subscription. If it doesn't exist in the API, it will be created.

params.name: name
params.description: A subscription name

params.name: topic
params.description: The topic to which the new subscription will be subscribed.

params.name: options
params.description: Please see Google\Cloud\PubSub\Subscription::create() for configuration details.

methods.name: subscription
methods.description:
Lazily instantiate a subscription with a subscription name.

This method will NOT perform any API calls. If you wish to create a new subscription, use Google\Cloud\PubSub\PubSubClient::subscribe().

Unless you are sure the subscription exists, you should check its existence before using it.

params.name: name
params.description: The subscription name

params.name: topicName
params.description: The topic name

methods.name: subscriptions
methods.description: Get a list of the subscriptions registered to all of your project's topics.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: createSnapshot
methods.description:
Create a snapshot.

Please note that this method may not yet be available in your project.

params.name: name
params.description: The snapshot name.

params.name: subscription
params.description: The subscription to take a snapshot of.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration options.

params.name: name
params.description: The snapshot name.

params.name: info
params.description: Snapshot info.

methods.name: snapshots
methods.description:
Get a list of the snapshots in the project.

Please note that this method may not yet be available in your project.

params.name: options
params.description: Configuration Options

params.name: options.pageSize
params.description: Maximum number of results to return per request.

params.name: options.resultLimit
params.description: Limit the number of results returned in total. Defaults to 0 (return all results).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: A previously-returned page token used to resume the loading of results from a specific point.

methods.name: consume
methods.description:
Consume an incoming message and return a PubSub Message.

This method is for use with push delivery only.

params.name: requestBody
params.description: The HTTP Request body

params.name: value
params.description: The timestamp value.

params.name: nanoSeconds
params.description: The number of nanoseconds in the timestamp.

params.name: seconds
params.description: The number of seconds in the duration.

params.name: nanos
params.description: The number of nanoseconds in the duration. Defaults to 0.
